intro: Borreria oaxacana, commonly known as Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract various pollinators. Borreria oaxacana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its latex sap contains milky substances, which can be toxic to some animals.
